name: Annville Stone Company, Appellant, v. Hershey Chocolate Corporation et al.
name_abbreviation: Annville Stone Co. v. Hershey Chocolate Corp.

judges: Before Maxey, C. J., Linn, Stern, Stearne and Jones, JJ.
parties: Annville Stone Company, Appellant, v. Hershey Chocolate Corporation et al.

opinions.text:
Opinion
per curiam,
On this appeal from a decree refusing a preliminary injunction, it appears that there were reasonable grounds for the action of the learned court below. The decree is, therefore, affirmed. See Cohen et al. v. A. M. Byers Company et al., 363 Pa. 618, 70 A. 2d 837.
Decree affirmed at appellant’s costs.
opinions.author: per curiam,

attorneys: Walter Biddle Saul, with him Anderson Page, John Y. Scott and Saul, Ewing, Remide é Saul, for appellant.
W. James Macintosh, with him Ernest R. von Starch, William H. Earnest, Henry A. Torchia, Morgan, Lewis A Bochius and Earnest & Torchia, for appellee.
